intro: Sphaerolobium benetectum, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a slender, often multi-branched stem and produces small, pod-like fruits. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of multiple pairs of small, oval-shaped leaflets. Sphaerolobium benetectum is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
